page.title: 04NEWBURY RACECOURSE
page.content: Newbury racecourse is opposite Stroud Green. It is a very large racecourse and races are held on most Saturdays and sometimes on Mondays and Tuesdays. It is quite a well known racecourse and some of the many races held there are on television. Many famous jockeys have raced there including Leicester Piggot and Willy Carson. It is common to see Royalty at meetings. The people of the area do get a little fed up with the problems of traffic caused by the races, and object to being forced off the road by Rolls Royces and BMWs. The people who attend the meetings appear to be in a world of their own. There is some employment created by the Racecourse.
